qas.question: How many Vestals were there in Rome?
Of what was Vesta the goddess?
Of what were the Vestals protectors?
What was the benefit of being a Vestal?
To whom did the Vestal answer?

context: The Vestals were a public priesthood of <a0_0>six<a0_0/> women devoted to the cultivation of Vesta, goddess of the <a1_0>hearth<a1_0/> of the Roman state and its <a2_0>vital flame<a2_0/>. A girl chosen to be a Vestal achieved unique religious distinction, public status and privileges, and could exercise considerable <a3_0>political influence<a3_0/>. Upon entering her office, a Vestal was emancipated from her father's authority. In archaic Roman society, these priestesses were the only women not required to be under the legal guardianship of a man, instead answering directly to the <a4_0>Pontifex Maximus<a4_0/>.
